page.title: 03Junkers JU 52 lands at Prees
page.content: Dateline 8th. June 1985. A massive World War Two German Transport plane made an unscheduled landing on Prees Heath on Saturday after developing engine trouble en route to Prestwick International Air Show.Pilot Richard Hawke landed the plane in a field next to the Prees Airstrip. None of the five crew injured and the aircraft was undamaged.The Junkers which is one of only 6 left in the world is about the size of a BAC 1/11 jet.It will remain at Prees until parts can be made and brought up to Prees.Mr May said they hoped to take off before the weekend ready for its next display in Holland. Prees is a wartime airstrip and is used by the Manchester Free Fall Parachute Club.
